episodeTitle: From the Sea, a Friend Arrives! The Straw Hats Share the Strongest Bond!
description: After Luffy's victory over Rob Lucci leaves him unable to move, the Straw Hats face the Buster Call's relentless assault. When all hope seems lost and they're cornered on the Bridge of Hesitation, a familiar voice calls out from the sea - the Going Merry has come to rescue them one final time.

events.title: Marines React to Rob Lucci's Defeat
events.description: The Marines are shocked by Rob Lucci's defeat. One Marine notes that Lucci was the strongest CP9 leader in the history of Cipher Pol, making his loss to Luffy even more significant.
events.significance: Establishes the magnitude of Luffy's victory and the growing threat the Straw Hats pose to the World Government.

quotes.text: He was the strongest CP9 leader in the history of Cipher Pol!
quotes.speaker: Marine
quotes.context: Reacting to Rob Lucci's defeat by Luffy

events.title: Luffy Unable to Move After Battle
events.description: Following his intense battle with Rob Lucci, Luffy has completely exhausted his strength and cannot move at all. The crew must figure out how to escape while protecting their immobilized captain.
events.significance: Creates dramatic tension and demonstrates the physical toll of Luffy's fight against one of the strongest CP9 agents.

events.title: Escape Ship Destroyed by Buster Call
events.description: The ship meant to carry the Straw Hats to safety is blown up by the Buster Call forces, with Kokoro, Chimney, and Chopper still on board. The crew watches in horror as their means of escape is destroyed.
events.significance: Eliminates the crew's escape route and raises the stakes of their desperate situation.

events.title: Sanji Rescues Survivors from Destroyed Ship
events.description: Sanji dramatically emerges from the wreckage of the destroyed ship, having rescued Kokoro, Chimney, and Chopper. Despite the explosion, all three are safe thanks to Sanji's quick actions.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's heroism and ensures all crew members and allies survive the initial Buster Call assault.

events.title: Franky Family and Galley-La Revealed to Be Alive
events.description: The Marines had announced the deaths of the Franky Family, Galley-La foremen, and the giants Oimo and Kashii. However, Zambai contacts the Straw Hats via Den Den Mushi, revealing they all survived thanks to the giants blocking the assault and Paulie's rope preventing them from falling.
events.significance: Provides hope and shows that the Straw Hats' allies survived against overwhelming odds, though the crew is still trapped.

events.title: Straw Hats Cornered by Five Battleships
events.description: The Straw Hats find themselves trapped on a platform with five Marine battleships surrounding them, all with cannons aimed directly at the crew. With Luffy unable to move and nowhere to run, the situation appears hopeless.
events.significance: Creates the darkest moment of the Enies Lobby escape, setting up the emotional rescue by Going Merry.

events.title: Sharinguru's Debut
events.description: Marine Captain Sharinguru appears for the first time, attacking Franky on the Bridge of Hesitation. Notably, in the anime version, Sharinguru uses a sword rather than his Devil Fruit ability, the Shari Shari no Mi.
events.significance: Introduces a new Marine character who possesses the Wheel-Wheel Fruit, though his powers are not shown in the anime.

events.title: Franky Defeats Sharinguru
events.description: Despite the brief confrontation with Marine Captain Sharinguru, Franky emerges victorious, defeating the sword-wielding Marine officer.
events.significance: Demonstrates Franky's combat capabilities and resolves the immediate threat, though the larger danger of the Buster Call remains.

events.title: Marines Begin Five-Second Countdown to Fire
events.description: The Marines begin a coordinated five-second countdown before all five battleships will fire their cannons simultaneously at the trapped Straw Hats. The tension mounts as the crew has no apparent way to escape.
events.significance: Creates maximum dramatic tension before the Going Merry's miraculous appearance.

events.title: Going Merry's Voice Calls to the Straw Hats
events.description: Usopp hears a mysterious voice, followed by the rest of the crew. The voice tells them to look down and jump into the sea. Despite never hearing this voice before, each Straw Hat recognizes it as belonging to the Going Merry - the ship's Klabautermann speaking to them.
events.significance: First time the Going Merry's spirit directly communicates with the entire crew, confirming the ship's sentience and deep bond with the Straw Hats. This is a pivotal supernatural moment in the series.

quotes.text: Jump into the sea! I'm here to save you!
quotes.speaker: Going Merry
quotes.context: The Going Merry's Klabautermann calling out to the Straw Hats

events.title: Usopp Orders Everyone to Jump
events.description: Recognizing the Going Merry's voice, Usopp proposes what seems like a suicidal plan: everyone should jump into the sea, even though Luffy, Robin, and Chopper cannot swim. He insists they have a friend waiting below who will save them.
events.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's faith in the Going Merry and his role as the crew member closest to their ship. His conviction convinces the others to trust in this desperate gambit.

events.title: Robin Uses Cien Fleur: Delphinium
events.description: As the cannons fire, Robin uses her Devil Fruit ability 'Cien Fleur: Delphinium' to carry the immobilized Luffy off the column and toward the sea below.
events.significance: Shows Robin's quick thinking and her ability to protect Luffy in his vulnerable state.

events.title: Going Merry Appears to Rescue the Crew
events.description: As the crew jumps into the sea to escape the cannon fire, the Going Merry appears below them, having sailed from Water 7 to Enies Lobby completely on its own. Despite being battered beyond repair, the ship's Klabautermann manifested to save the Straw Hats one final time.
events.significance: One of the most emotional moments in One Piece. The Going Merry's autonomous journey through the Grand Line's dangerous waters demonstrates the profound bond between ship and crew. This miracle was made possible by the ship's spirit and the crew's love for their vessel.

quotes.text: I've come to take you all home!
quotes.speaker: Going Merry
quotes.context: The Going Merry welcoming the crew aboard

events.title: All Straw Hats Land Safely on Going Merry
events.description: The entire crew successfully lands on the Going Merry's deck, escaping the cannon barrage. Despite their dire situation moments before, all members are now safe aboard their beloved ship, ready to make their final escape from Enies Lobby.
events.significance: Completes the rescue and reunites the crew with their ship for the last voyage together. Sets up the emotional farewell that will come in episode 312.

themes.description: The episode's title 'The Straw Hats Share the Strongest Bond' is exemplified by the Going Merry's miraculous return. The ship's love for the crew transcends the physical limitations of an inanimate object.
themes.symbolism: The Going Merry represents the physical manifestation of the crew's bonds - their shared memories, adventures, and love for one another given form as a ship's spirit.
culturalReferences: The Klabautermann is based on German maritime folklore about ship spirits

themes.description: The Going Merry, despite being battered and broken beyond repair, risks complete destruction to save the crew one final time. This mirrors the crew's own willingness to risk everything for their friends.
themes.symbolism: The ship sailing through impossible conditions represents the power of determination and love to overcome any obstacle.

themes.description: The episode demonstrates that genuine care and devotion can create miracles. The Going Merry's impossible journey from Water 7 to Enies Lobby is only possible because of the crew's love for their ship.
themes.symbolism: The manifestation of the Klabautermann represents how cherished objects can develop a spirit through the love given to them.

characterSpotlights.development: Completely immobilized after defeating Rob Lucci, Luffy must rely entirely on his crew to survive. This reversal of his usual protective role highlights the importance of teamwork.
keyActions: Remains immobilized after his battle with Rob Lucci
Carried to safety by Robin's Devil Fruit powers

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp's special bond with the Going Merry is highlighted as he's the first to recognize the ship's voice. His conviction convinces the crew to trust in the impossible and jump into the sea.
keyActions: First to hear Going Merry's voice
Convinces the crew to jump into the sea
Demonstrates his unique connection to the ship

characterSpotlights.development: The Going Merry's Klabautermann fully manifests, allowing the ship to speak directly to the crew and sail independently to their rescue. This confirms the ship's sentience and demonstrates its love for the Straw Hats.
keyActions: Sails from Water 7 to Enies Lobby autonomously
Speaks to the crew for the first time
Positions itself to catch all crew members
Successfully rescues everyone from certain death
quotes: Jump into the sea! I'm here to save you!
I've come to take you all home!

characterSpotlights.development: Robin uses her abilities to save Luffy, showing how far she's come from being the one who needed saving at the start of this arc.
keyActions: Uses Cien Fleur: Delphinium to carry Luffy
Ensures all crew members can escape together

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates his protective nature by saving Kokoro, Chimney, and Chopper from the destroyed ship.
keyActions: Rescues Kokoro, Chimney, and Chopper from ship explosion
Emerges from wreckage with all three safe

mangaDifferences.difference: In the anime, Sharinguru uses a sword against Franky. In the manga, he uses his Shari Shari no Mi Devil Fruit powers to attack with rotating body parts.

trivia.fact: Sharinguru is the only canon Devil Fruit user to have their powers completely excluded from the anime adaptation.
The Going Merry is voiced by Megumi Toyoguchi in Japanese and Monica Rial in English, giving the ship's Klabautermann a childlike voice.
This episode aired on May 20, 2007 in Japan and achieved a 9.5% viewership rating, ranking 5th for that week.
Episode 310 does not have an ending theme song, as One Piece stopped using ending themes from episode 279 to episode 1070 to allow for longer opening sequences.

sources.title: Why did the anime stop having ending songs since episode 279?

trivia.fact: In a worldwide poll for the One Piece anime's 25th anniversary, the Going Merry's farewell (which culminates in episode 312) was voted the most beloved moment in One Piece.

sources.title: It's Been 18 Years Since One Piece Fans Said Farewell to the Best Ship
